Function Documentation

nitf_IOInterface* nitf_IOHandleAdaptor_construct ( nitf_IOHandle  handle,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

This special 'subclass' puts the IOHandle into the IOInterface that is needed to supply it for reads and writes within the library.

You can define your own interfaces, and set them using the nitf_Reader_setInputSource() and the nitf_Writer_setOutputDest()

NITF_BOOL nitf_IOInterface_close ( nitf_IOInterface *  io,
nitf_Error *  error 
)

void nitf_IOInterface_destruct ( nitf_IOInterface **  io  ) 

'Destructor' for IOInterface. This relies on its internal iface, pointer table to determine how/if to destruct the NITF_DATA* data field.
